title: Fifty Shades of Chicken - A Parody in a Cookbook - F L Fowler -
description:
#1 Best Seller in Cooking Humor(Amazon)

Fifty Shades of Chicken: A Parody in a Cookbook

By F.L. Fowler

Hardcover: 160 pages - Publisher: Clarkson Potter 
(November 13, 2012) - Language: English
ISBN-10: 0385345224 - ISBN-13: 978-0385345224

Dripping Thighs, Sticky Chicken Fingers, Vanilla Chicken, Chicken with a Lardon, Bacon-Bound Wings, Spatchcock Chicken, Learning-to-Truss-You Chicken, Holy Hell Wings, Mustard-Spanked Chicken, and more, more, more!
 
Fifty chicken recipes, each more seductive than the last, in a book that makes every dinner a turn-on.

Fifty preparations. He promises weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll start out slow, with wine and a good oiling . . . Holy crap. Ã¢â‚¬Å“I will control everything that happens here,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ he says. So begins the adventures of Miss Chicken, a young free-range, from raw innocence to golden brown ecstasy, in this spoof-in-a-cookbook that simmers in the afterglow of E.L. JamesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s sensational Fifty Shades of Grey trilogy. Like Anastasia Steele, Miss Chicken finds herself at the mercy of a dominating man, in this case, a wealthy, sexy, and very hungry chef.  

And before long, from unbearably slow drizzling to trussing, Miss Chicken discovers the sheer thrill of becoming the main course. With memorable tips and revealing photographs, Fifty Shades of Chicken will have you dominating dinner.
